lines.text:
[starts the opening credits]
... Terrahawks! Stay on this channel! This is an emergency!
[Tiger has been wounded during a battle with one of Zelda's cubes]
How's the arm?
I'll live.
I was afraid of that.
[Tiger has taken a sip of coffee]
What did you make this coffee with - sawdust?
Certainly not.
[to himself]
Might not be a bad idea.

[after Zero and three Zeroids have landed near the bridge they must destroy]
What we need is a length of pipe.

[French Accent]
Well, that should not be difficult to find, near a refinery for oil!
So what are you standing around here for, lad? Move yourself!
[Dix-Huit goes to find a length of pipe, and Zero turns to face Nine-Eight and Nine-Nine]
Always stand up-wind of that one. They do say he puts *garlic* in his lubrication oil!

[his favorite response to nearly anything]
... Exactry.

[his favorite exclamation]
... Flaming thunderbolts!

[his #1 rule-of-thumb]
... Expect the unexpected.

[after a mid-air rendezvous with Kate]
We must stop meeting like this.
You're nothing if not original.

[Zero and three Zeroids are in front of a length of pipe, which is pointing towards a bridge near the Shale refinery]
And that, Dix-Huit, is how we are going to destroy the bridge.

[French accent]
Is impossible! You would never get a man to do this!
What? You never heard of them human cannonballs?

[French accent]
The humans, they do this?

[after landing in the desert]
That stuff's hard. As hard as Ninestein's heart.

[Zeroid Two-One reveals he's worried by the tone of Dr Ninestein's voice]
Don't worry, lad. There's more than one way to skin a cat, or in his case, a tiger!
